channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Su-57 fighter jets, labour and civil nuclear cooperation… Deals likely to be cracked during Putin’s India visit
Inside the presidential suite that Putin will spend the night during India visit
Why $2 billion Russia nuclear submarine deal is a big boon to India
Phone calls and bilaterals: How Putin and Modi have engaged in the last 2 years
‘Flying Kremlin’, bulky bodyguards and poop suitcase… How Vladimir Putin travels abroad
‘Kill all to be martyr’: Inside Pakistani-origin man’s foiled mass shooting plan at Delaware campus
The debt trap: Why Pakistan can’t escape its economic collapse
item.description: Pakistan currently faces $130 billion in external debt—that’s 352 per cent of its total exports and 39 per cent of gross national income

item.title: Putin in Delhi: India’s moment in a fragmenting world order
item.description: Vladimir Putin’s arrival in New Delhi, in the shadow of tariffs, war and an evolving peace plan, is one of the most consequential international events of the year

item.title: Putin’s Delhi visit poised to propel military aviation ties to new heights
item.description: Military aviation remains the biggest India-Russia ‘bear hug’ with the most significant hardware transfers

item.title: Imran Khan is not dead, and neither is Pakistan’s ‘House of Cards’ politics
item.description: Pakistan is again living through its own ‘House of Cards’ moment. Imran Khan, who once was the country’s most visible, loudest, and most defiantly public political figure, now exists in Pakistan’s political imagination more as a contested idea than as a tangible presence

item.title: How India’s BrahMos missile deal with Indonesia signals a new strategic era
item.description: As Jakarta moves closer to a $450 million BrahMos purchase, India emerges as Southeast Asia’s long-awaited alternative amid the US-China rivalry

item.title: Teesta project: How Chinese involvement raises India’s eastern security concerns
item.description: Bangladesh’s invitation to China for the Teesta project alters more than a riverbank. It reshapes the security calculus of eastern India
